Animal Name: Maned Wolf 
Scientific Name: Chrysocyon brachyurus 
IUCN Conservation Status: Near Threatened 
Habitats: Grasslands with scattered bushes and trees 
Countries: Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, Peru, Paraguay 
Summary: The maned wolf is a large canine of South America. It is found in Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, Peru, and Paraguay. Its markings resemble those of foxes but it is neither a fox nor a wolf. It is the only species in the genus Chrysocyon (meaning “golden dog”).
